item.title: A Big Change Has Been Made to Xbox 360 Dashboard
item.description:
Highlights

  • Xbox 360 Store has been removed from the Dashboard, ending the era of buying digital games directly on the console.
  • Despite Marketplace closure, Xbox Live still works smoothly, earning Achievements and backward-compatible games still accessible.
  • New Dashboard update brings a cleaner look but marks the end of an era for Xbox 360 fans. Hope remains for a final sleek update.

The Xbox 360 Store has been removed from the new Xbox 360 Dashboard. As the Xbox 360 Marketplace has recently shut down, the era of purchasing digital games on the console has come to an end. While some titles remain due to its backward compatibility from the current generation of gaming, users will not be able to buy any kind of content using the system itself.

While the Xbox 360 isn't the pioneer of digital gaming, the Xbox 360 Marketplace was iconic and helped usher in a new age in gaming. The Xbox 360 Store became home to not just full retail releases, but also Xbox Live Arcade and Xbox Live Indie Games as well. Even through the release of both the Xbox One and the Xbox Series X/S, the 360 store had remained active for users, which allowed those who owned the older system to still enjoy titles they wished to own. However, it seems the Xbox 360 Marketplace's closure has prompted Microsoft to update the 360's look as well.

Twitter user Stallion83 shared the new Xbox 360 Dashboard, which sees the disappearance of the Xbox 360 Store. While the old dashboard home screen used to have tabs reflecting Bing, home, social, movies & TV, apps, and settings, the updated one looks and feels bare. The only remaining tabs from the aforementioned ones are home, social, and settings. This is a huge change from the previously full home screen. While some users have commented that it feels and looks cleaner, others lamented that the new screen could use premium themes to change its look. However, as the Xbox 360 store is closed, fans may need to rely on themes they own.

What Can Fans Do With Their Xbox 360 After The Store's Closure?

One worry that fans had was Xbox Live usability. Surprisingly, Stallion83 confirmed that Xbox Live still worked like a charm and that games which were purchased digitally still work with no problems. Xbox 360 Achievements can still be earned, and still contribute to the Gamerscore. Xbox 360 Games with backward compatibility released on newer consoles can still be purchased using an Xbox Series X/S, which should allow some digital activity on the system. Fans may still download previous purchases using the download history. As one commenter shared, some games like King's Quest, which need add-ons and compatibility packs to work, can still be bought.

While this serves as a stark reminder that the Xbox 360's support is slowly diminishing, a few commenters raised some positive notes regarding the new look. Many fans agreed that ads on Xbox are bothersome, and that at least their disappearance on Xbox 360 is a huge improvement. Still, the shared sentiment is that the new change does mark the end of an era. While highly unlikely, some users hope that Microsoft still gives one final update to the dashboard so that things will be more sleek and easily accessible.

item.title: Pokemon GO: Best Moveset For Moltres
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Moveset For Moltres in Pokemon GO

In Pokemon GO, Raid bosses are some of the strongest beings in the game, as they often feature Legendary, Mythical, and Mega-Evolved Pokemon. Because of this, Trainers very frequently make the most of Raid Battle opportunities to add some hugely powerful additions to their team, so they can further use them in future battles.

No matter, if you're looking to utilize Moltres in PvE or PvP battles, ensuring you have the strongest possible moveset equipped, is important. When considering the best moveset for a Pokemon, there are many factors to take into consideration, so players can find all of the information they'll need to prepare their Moltres for Pokemon GO battles.

Best Moveset For Moltres in Pokemon GO

In Pokemon GO , Moltres is a Fire and Flying Dual-Type Pokemon with some powerful stats at 3917 CP, 251 ATK, 181 DEF, and 207 STA . As such a strong Pokemon, Moltres is often used in PvE and PvP battles as part of a reliable team composition, or to counter specific opponents. However, in order to ensure your Moltres operates the most efficiently in battle and is able to take down foes with the most ease, equipping the best possible moveset is crucial.

In addition to selecting a powerful moveset, Moltres also has its power boosted in both Windy and Sunny Weather , so Trainers should look to utilize battle opportunities in this condition.

The best possible moveset for Moltres is determined for the most part, by damage per second and total damage output. When utilizing the best moveset combination, players can expect Moltres to deal 17.37 damage per second , and a total damage output of 524.5 before fainting in battle.

However, depending on your circumstances, the Pokemon you plan to take on, and the Type coverage in the rest of your team, you may need to alter this combination slightly. For this reason, additional moveset recommendations have been included for Moltres below, ordered by potential damage output.

Best Moltres Moveset

  • Fast Move : Fire Spin
  • Charged Move : Sky Attack

Secondary Moltres Moveset Options

item.title: Minecraft Partners with Lush for Bath Bombs
item.description:
Highlights

  • Minecraft and Lush have teamed up to create bath products based on the game, available for purchase.
  • The collaboration features real-world and in-game items, providing fans with unique ways to relax.
  • Minecraft is celebrating its fifteenth anniversary with new merchandise, giveaways, and partnerships.

A collaboration most Minecraft players wouldn't have seen coming has been announced, with Minecraft and cosmetics retailer Lush teaming up for a collaboration. The collab features Minecraft -themed products from Lush, as well as an in-game series of bath bombs that fans can utilize, with special benefits attached to them.

Minecraft is celebrating its fifteenth anniversary this year, and this new collaboration is part of it. Minecraft has also been exciting fans with things like in-game giveaways as well as new merchandise reveals.

Minecraft and Lush have paired up to produce twelve new real-world products, as well as four in-game items that players can pick up. The products are clever, with each designed to resemble an in-game object or creature, all while giving the player an opportunity to unwind and relax with either a shower or a bath. For the moment, the products are only available via the Lush app, but will arrive in physical retail stores and be sold on the main Lush site in the near future. Meanwhile, Minecraft: Bedrock Edition is getting a free Lush Bath Bombs add-on. The add-on will let players craft and buy four kinds of bath bombs that afford the player bonuses like calming Minecraft' s hostile mobs and produce a cool visual effect.

Minecraft x Lush Bath Products

  • TNT Block Bath Bomb - £3.75 ($4.77 USD)
    • Scent: jasmine, ylang-ylang and clary sage
    • Red and white fizz with a crackling, popping sound

  • Grass Block Bath Bomb - £3.75
    • Scent: neroli and sandalwood Grass
    • Fluffy "moss-inspired" foam

  • Lava Block Bath Bomb, £3.75
    • Scent: lemon and bergamot
    • Swirls of orange and a "jelly lava" flow

  • Creeper Shower Bomb, £3.75
    • Scent: lemongrass
    • Green foam and froth

  • Intergalactic Block Bath Bomb, £3.75
    • Grapefruit and peppermint scent (Same as Lush's standard intergalactic bath bomb)

  • Diamond Ore Diamond Ore Bath Bomb, £3.75
    • Scent: bergamot and cassis

  • Axolotl Axolotl Bath Bomb, £12
    • Scent: Vanilla absolute and almond
    • Contains one of five Axolotl soaps in varying colors

  • Ender Dragon Egg Giant Bath Bomb, £16
    • Scent: rose and lemon
    • Breaks apart to be used across multiple baths

  • Bucket Of Milk Shower Jelly, £8
    • Scent: patchouli and Brazilian orange oil

  • Diamond Pickaxe Reusable Bubble Bar, £9
    • Scent: cinnamon leaf and patchouli
    • Can be used multiple times to create bubble baths

  • Enderman Shower Bomb, £3.75
    • Scent: lavender and chamomile
    • Produces purple foam

  • Skeleton Shower Bomb, £3.75
    • Scent: Sicilian lemon and rose

  • Totem Of Undying Soap – £7.00 each
    • Scent: Brazilian orange and bergamot

Of course, these aren't the only things that have been released for Minecraft fans to celebrate the fifteenth anniversary. Players have also been treated to new maps, new Minecraft LEGO sets were revealed, and even Google celebrated the megahit game's anniversary. As Minecraft 's exact fifteeneth anniversary was only a few months ago, chances are that there is still more to come for players to look forward to. Fans will have to wait and see, but it's an exciting time to be a Minecraft fan regardless.

item.title: Best Games To Play If You Like Diablo 4
item.description:
Diablo 4 was officially announced in November 2019, with the game launching in June 2023. It promised to be the most ambitious and significant entry in the series yet, and Blizzard did a lot of things right and wrong for the game's launch period. Released in 1997, the first Diablo defined the isometric action-RPG hack-and-slash looting genre and every similar game since it has been referred to as a Diablo clone.

All the numbered entries in the franchise have sold well and are highly regarded in their own right, and the universe has been expanded through toys, novels, and comics. The series has become a cultural phenomenon over the years, and Diablo 4 is no exception. Still, fans of the genre can entertain themselves with some good games like Diablo 4 that embody the RPG elements and hack-and-slash goodness of this popular title.

Updated on August 1, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: The Diablo series is one of the most popular hack-and-slash titles around, even if there are some people who feel that Blizzard dropped the ball when it came to this title's potential. That being said, there's no denying that this popular dungeon crawler is unlike any other title out there, and players will love building the character they want to explore the open world of this title and take out the many threats that stand in their way. The build variety ensures that players won't be bored of this game anytime soon, but people who have spent hundreds of hours exploring everything this game has to offer can check out other games like Diablo 4 that will scratch the itch this title leaves behind.

26 Wolcen: Lords Of Mayhem

A Dark-Fantasy Action RPG Perfect For Diablo Fans

There's no denying that Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem has its fair share of problems, with the broken nature of this title at launch being a huge reason why so many people didn't choose to play this title when it came out. However, a lot of time has passed since its release, and it can safely be said that the majority of bugs and glitches plaguing this title have been fixed.

As it stands, the dark fantasy roots of this title coupled with the excellent hack-and-slash gameplay make it worth checking out for fans of the series. Wolcen: Lords of Mayhem employs procedural generation to ensure that the title's replayability is as high as possible, making it one of the best games like Diablo 4 players can check out.

25 Last Epoch

An Underrated Action Title With Diablo-esque Hack-and-Slash Combat

Last Epoch had been in Early Access for the longest time, with the title slowly polishing its gameplay loop and taking fan feedback into account to ensure that its hack-and-slash goodness was as refined as could be. After years of slowly sanding out the rough edges, Last Epoch was released to positive reviews and is one of the best games like Diablo 4 that players can check out.

The world of Eterra is a blast to explore, and players will love checking out how these landscapes change over the course of multiple timelines. The end game of this title is a blast to explore since the content present here is so immense that players will be challenged no matter how OP they think their build is.

24 Chronicon

A Pixelated ARPG That Diablo Fans Will Love

One of the most underrated ARPGs of all time, it's a shame that more people don't know about Chronicon . The game is overflowing with content and has staked a claim as one of the best games like Diablo 4 players can check out for themselves. The pixel art graphics are charming and further add to the allure of this title.

The game's loot is so abundant that players will be changing their gear time and time again, to the point where it can be overwhelming for some players. However, plentiful content is never a bad thing, and players who want to check out an indie ARPG with a lot of heart will love what Chronicon brings to the table.

23 Tyranny

A Fascinating Exploration Of Evil In A CRPG With Real-Time Combat

Obsidian Entertainment is one of the most legendary developers of RPG games that fans love. Their work in the CRPG genre has been nothing short of phenomenal, with Tyranny being one of their best offerings. Barring an ending that feels somewhat anticlimactic (likely due to budget reasons), Tyranny is a stellar example of how important it is for a proper role-playing experience to feature some thought-provoking writing.

The gameplay of Tyranny features a healthy dose of real-time combat augmented by an innovative magic system that makes controlling a mage the objectively best way to gain levels, barrel through enemies, and interact with a major chunk of the gameplay. The game can get pretty challenging at times, making it important to set up proper party tactics that help players deal with a wide variety of enemies without facing too many issues.

22 Pillars Of Eternity

Obsidian's Return To Form With An Amazing CRPG Where Combat Is A Huge Focus

Pillars of Eternity is the game that saved Obsidian Entertainment from bankruptcy after a string of financial problems almost shut the studio down. After turning to Kickstarter in a desperate attempt to fund their game, the support these developers received helped Pillars of Eternity become a reality and let players experience a modern CRPG, which was a rarity at the time.

The real-time combat is a blast to engage with and a formula that Obsidian slowly improved with each entry that expanded on these concepts, and interacting with a vast and diverse party as players explored a litany of dungeons made for a great time. It may be a far cry from Diablo 4 's refiled hack-and-slash combat, but fans of top-down combat will find a lot to love about Pillars of Eternity .

21 Divinity: Original Sin 2

One Of The Deepest RPG Experiences With A Focus On Tactics And Loot

Divinity: Original Sin 2 is one of the greatest CRPGs of all time, with Larian's improvements in this sequel making it clear why Baldur's Gate 3 was destined for success all along. The epic scope of this RPG coupled with the wealth of content players could access made Original Sin 2 a vast improvement over its predecessor in every way.

The combat of this game is certainly a stark departure from Diablo 4 's swift hack-and-slash goodness, but the cerebral goodness of depleting a character's Physical and Magical Armour before wreaking havoc on their health is something that fans love. The loot-driven gameplay is also quite reminiscent of Diablo 4 and something that will help fans of this game slowly ease into the rich, layered goodness of Original Sin 2 's RPG goodness.

20 Baldur's Gate 3

A Rich RPG With An Emphasis On Loot And Character Builds

Baldur's Gate 3 is one of the best video games ever made. It's a shining example of what good quality RPGs with amazing writing, branching narratives, and a ton of love can achieve over the many soulless AAA offerings that have soured the landscape of gaming.

Like Diablo 4 , the top-down perspective (which does have a ton of flexibility, allowing players to scroll around their surroundings within certain limits), tactical combat, and an emphasis on looting as well as optimizing character builds permeate this wonderful experience. Players will love gathering a party and forming the best strategies to take out the many foes that stand in their way.

19 Lionheart: Legacy Of The Crusader

Excellent Real-Time Combat In A CRPG With One Of The Strongest First Impressions In Gaming

  • Launched: 2003
  • Developer: Reflexive Entertainment
  • Platform: PC

Lionheart: Legacy of the Crusader is a huge what-if in the realm of video games, and it's a shame that more people haven't heard of this amazing game. Players were transported to a version of the past with magic steeped in the game world, interacting with real-life personalities like Leonardo da Vinci and William Shakespeare.

The game's intricate opening in Barcelona makes for a great time, and it's a shame that the title ends up devolving into inane madness where players are forced into brutal encounters across tough dungeons over and over again. Still, the Diablo -esque combat has its moments, and the novelty of the game's unique setting is riveting to this day.

18 Lord Of The Rings: War In The North

A Fun RPG With Co-op Support And Classic Hack-and-Slash Gameplay

The studio that created Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance 2 also produced Lord of the Rings: War in the North . Often overlooked by modern standards, the action RPG is one of the best video game adaptations of the Lord of the Rings franchise.

Somewhat comparable to Dark Alliance 2 , War in the North is an accessible RPG that isn't bogged down with needless complexities, but there is a lot of depth and flexibility in its mechanics. Furthermore, players can enjoy the game with friends and family in couch co-op action, which adds replayability. The campaign features three playable characters who are all fairly different from each other, allowing the hack-and-slash combat to shine.

17 Warhammer: Chaosbane

An Isometric Action RPG Set In The Warhammer Universe

Chances are, Diablo players are also familiar with Warhammer since the two properties share quite a few things in common. That said, Warhammer has produced roughly a billion games, most of which go unnoticed by anyone who is not a die-hard fan of the tabletop game. Warhammer: Chaosbane is one such title, which is a shame as its awesome hack-and-slash gameplay should entertain most fans of isometric action RPGs, regardless of their familiarity with the overall brand.

Similar to Diablo 4 , Chaosbane works brilliantly on PC and consoles, with both sides bringing different positives and strengths to the table. The game's grimdark aesthetic is also very similar to Blizzard's franchise, and Chaosbane 's thrilling boss fights would not feel out of place in a Diablo project.

16 Warframe

A Looter Shooter With A Focus On Getting The Best Gear Possible

Loot is a big part of Diablo 4 , and a game that also focuses on this is Warframe, a third-person shooter game set in a futuristic world. It's not very similar to Diablo 4 in many other ways, but fans after a slightly different experience should check this game out.

Role-playing games are big business these days, and Warframe has grown into a huge success story over the last decade. Hard as it is to believe considering its generally positive current reception, the third-person action title launched to a fairly tepid initial response, largely thanks to its repetitive structure and corridor-based stages. Digital Extremes spent the next few years improving and expanding the game, resulting in arguably one of the most complete packages in the RPG genre.

Nowadays, Warframe has open-world sections, extensive and addictive lore, and highly entertaining combat that blends shooter and melee elements well. A bonus is that it's free to play and available on the big consoles; therefore, if fans are still aching from the big-money purchase of Diablo 4 , this game would be a good one to try next.

15 Justice League Heroes

A Justice League Game With Top-Down Hack-and-Slash Gameplay

Another action RPG using the Dark Alliance engine, Justice League Heroes is the DC equivalent of the Marvel Ultimate Alliance series. Similarly, it allows players to create dream teams featuring their favorite superheroes like Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern, and more.

Like Marvel Ultimate Alliance, fans can switch between characters in solo mode or play it with friends and family in couch co-op modes. In addition to well-known DC heroes, supervillains like Brainiac, Gorilla Grodd, and Killer Frost show up as bosses to fight against.

14 Champions: Return To Arms

A Top-Down Action RPG With Branching Storylines And A Lot Of Gameplay

  • Launched : 2005
  • Developer : Snowblind Studios
  • Platform : PS2

The sequel to Champions of Norath and set in the Everquest universe, Champions: Return to Arms is a PS2 exclusive that runs on Snowblind's Dark Alliance engine. Unlike Everquest, Champions is not an MMORPG but a top-down action RPG where players can fight alone or with friends.

In addition, Champions: Return to Arms features good and evil choices that affect the narrative and mission criteria. Fans of Diablo will appreciate the depth and scope of Champions as the game has over 100 hours of gameplay with branching storylines to enjoy.

13 Hades

An Excellent Roguelite Action Game With Amazing Voice Action And Visual Design

As a Roguelike RPG, Hades is quite different from the Diablo series. However, as one of the best hack-and-slash titles in years, fans will find a lot to enjoy in its unique spin on escaping the bowels of hell.

The comic book-like aesthetic and humor set it apart from Diablo , but the moreish gameplay loop and deep gameplay will keep fans busy for a long time. SuperGiant Games announced that the sequel Hades 2 would launch in Early Access in 2023.

12 The Golden Axe Series

A Legendary Arcade Hack-and-Slash Game

  • Launched: 1989
  • Developer: Sega
  • Platform: Arcade, Amiga, Atari ST, Amstrad, Commodore 64, Game, IBM, Gear, Genesis/Megadrive, Master System, PC, PC-Engine, PS3, PS4, Switch, Wii Virtual Console, Wonderswan, Xbox 360, Xbox Arcade, Xbox One, and ZX Spectrum.

Inspired by the Sword and Sorcery genre that peaked in the 1980s with classics like Conan the Barbarian , Beast Master , and Willow , Golden Axe had launched to critical acclaim and is celebrated as one of the best hack-and-slash arcade games. Mixing elements from Tolkienesque fantasy and Hyborian Age fantasy books, Golden Axe allows players to choose a barbarian, an Amazonian warrior, and a dwarven fighter.

Despite its age, the Golden Axe trilogy is timeless as a couch co-op classic, and the responsive timing-based gameplay adds a sense of accomplishment. The trilogy is available on the Switch, PlayStation, and Xbox online stores as part of the Sega Vintage Collection and Sega Megadrive/Genesis Classics .

11 Darksiders: Genesis

A Top-Down Action RPG Set In The Darksiders Series

A prequel and a spin-off to the Darksiders series, Darksiders: Genesis is a top-down hack-and-slash action RPG that puts players in the shoes of one of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse, Strife. The gameplay is closer to Diablo than its predecessors. It features a two-player couch co-op via a split screen and is a blast with friends or family.

Fans enjoyed a more personal story that focuses on Strife. They appreciated that the game gave players a meaningful look at the Darksiders universe and the events before the first title.

10 Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order

A Much-Awaited Third Entry In The Popular Marvel Ultimate Alliance Series With Top-Down Combat

Released in 2019 for the Nintendo Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order is a sequel and a reboot for the isometric action RPG series. This entry is more of a soft reboot than a continuation of its predecessors, marking the beginning of a new story in a different universe.

However, even though it is a standalone game taking inspiration from the Marvel Cinematic Universe, the core gameplay mechanics remain intact. Ultimate Alliance 3 has faster combat and feels smoother than its predecessors. Fans have several Marvel superheroes to unlock with a deep skill tree to upgrade.

9 Baldur’s Gate: Dark Alliance Series

Legendary Isometric Action RPGs That Many Fans Have Fond Memories With

Baldur’s Gate: Dark Alliance and its sequel launched in 2001 and 2004, respectively. The games are isometric action-RPG spin-offs for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox to Baldur’s Gate series that were only available on the PC then.

Like its PC cousins, Dark Alliance is based in the Forgotten Realms Dungeons & Dragons universe, where players can choose a human archer, an elven sorceress, or a dwarven fighter. Dark Alliance 2 added new classes, the human barbarian, a drow monk, a moon-elf necromancer, a dwarven rogue, and a human cleric.

8 Shadows: Awakening

A Competent Diable Clone With Some Unique Twists Of Its Own

  • Launched : 2018
  • Developer : Games Farm
  • Platform : PC, PS4, and Xbox One

Launched in 2018, Shadows: Awakening is an action RPG developed and published by Kalypso Media. Awakening is a hack-and-slash Diablo clone with just enough twists and gameplay mechanics to keep it unique.

Players must explore a parallel universe and switch between the Shadow Realm and the natural world to solve puzzles and discover more secrets and loot. Awakening offers a choice of three different characters with distinct storylines. The characters can absorb the souls of 14 characters and seamlessly switch between them while playing.

7 Sacred 2: Fallen Angel

An Open-World Isometric Hack-and-Slash RPG With A Massive World

  • Launched : 2009
  • Developer : Ascaran
  • Platform : PC, PS3, and Xbox 360

Launched in 2008, Sacred 2: Fallen Angel is an isometric hack-and-slash action RPG. As well as offering similar mechanics to the Diablo series, Sacred 2 takes place in a massive and varied open world that spans 22 square miles.

Players can choose from seven classes the Seraphim, the undead Shadow Warrior, the high elf mage, the Dryad, the ranged warrior, a Temple Guardian, an Inquisitor, and the Dragon Mage. There are two paths to follow, light and dark, depending on the choices made and hundreds of side quests completed.

item.title: Diablo 4 Adding Classic Diablo 2 Enemies in Season 5
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Fell Council, previously seen in Diablo 2, is returning as bosses in Diablo 4's new mode, Infernal Hordes, adding to the game's depth.
  • in addition, Season 5 of Diablo 4 will introduce new content like Burning Aether currency and Spoils of Hell chests with Legendary items.

Diablo 4 has shown new footage of the Fell Council, one of the game's new bosses, which was seen for the first time in Diablo 2 . The council will join the game with the start of Diablo 4 's fifth season, addressing players' requests to see more Diablo 2 flavor in the latest entry of the series.

This isn't the only return of characters seen in previous Diablo games, as Diablo 4 players know some names like Ashava the Pestilent, a giant demon with massive blades on its arms, who was previously seen in Diablo Immortal . Another character familiar to fans is Lyndon the Scoundrel, a Diablo 4 NPC who appeared in Diablo 3 and the Reaper of Souls expansion. It's impossible not to mention Butcher, a demon who gave Diablo 4 players nightmares, who was seen before in Diablo , Diablo 3 , and Diablo Immortal . For Diablo 4 Season 5, Blizzard is bringing back faces familiar to seasoned Diablo players.

During the Campfire Chat broadcast on August 1, Diablo 4 revealed footage of the Fell Council. Formed by Geleb the Flame, Bremm the Maelstrom, Wyand the Shadow, Maffer the Cruel, and Ismael the Accursed, the characters will be the bosses of Diablo 4 's new mode, Infernal Hordes. When players beat the enemy waves, three random members of the Fell Council will appear for battle. According to Diablo 4 , there will be 10 possible variations of this encounter, which the devs believe will "create many different flavors of the boss fight."

Diablo 4 Bringing Back Diablo 2 Characters in New Game Mode

For veteran players, the presence of the Fell Council is nothing new, as Diablo 4 's new enemies were one of the threats seen in Diablo 2 . In the second game in the franchise, the council members were once generous men who led Zakarum. Their fight to contain Mephisto was unsuccessful, and they were all corrupted and transformed into agents of evil with powerful abilities. Eventually, Diablo 2 players had to send the group straight to hell.

When Diablo 4 's fifth season begins, players who defeat the Fell Council will receive Burning Aether. With this currency, players will be able to buy Spoils of Hell, chests into which Diablo 4 will place Legendary and Unique items, Summoning Materials, and Gold. But this won't be the only new feature of the fifth season, which will bring content such as more questlines, a new battle pass, and the anticipated rework of Diablo 4 's Uniques.
